IJSonParser

Defines an interface for parsing JSON files.

Header

Parsers/JSon/IJsonParser.h

Functions
LoadDOM
virtual CRefObj<IJSonObj> LoadDOM(
std::wstring& fn
) = 0

Loads the Document object model from the specified JSON file

Parameters
fn
std::wstring&

name of file from which to read

SaveDOM

CRefObj<IJSonObj>& dom,
std::wstring& fn
) = 0

Saves the Document object model (DOM) to the specified JSON file

Parameters
dom
CRefObj<IJSonObj>&

our JSON tree

fn
std::wstring&

name of file to write to

ReadDOM
virtual CRefObj<IJSonObj> ReadDOM(
const char* pBuffer
) = 0

Reads a JSON tree from the specified null terminated string buffer

Parameters
pBuffer
const char*

buffer that contains JSON data

Returns

A JSON Document object model (DOM)

WriteDOM
virtual uint32 WriteDOM(
CRefObj<IJSonObj>& dom,
char* pBuffer,
uint32 bufLen
) = 0

Writes a JSON tree to the specified buffer. To determine how big the buffer must be to contain the JSON text, you may call this method with a nullptr for 'pBuffer' and it will return the number of characters the buffer requires.

Parameters
dom
CRefObj<IJSonObj>&

JSON tree to write

pBuffer
char*

buffer to write to. Maybe nullptr, in which case the method returns the required size of the buffer in characters.

bufLen
uint32

length of buffer

Returns

Number of characters written
